intro: Homalium hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy homalium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It produces orange or red berries that are edible and often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
